fields.value: Replication Data for: Global Sequestration Potential of Increased Organic Carbon in Cropland Soils

authorAffiliation.value: Kunming Institute of Botany, Chinese Academy of Sciences
International Center for Tropical Agriculture - CIAT
International Center for Tropical Agriculture - CIAT

datasetContactAffiliation.value: International Center for Tropical Agriculture - CIAT

dsDescriptionValue.value:
These datasets were developed as part of an analysis of the carbon sequestration potential of increasing soil organic carbon on croplands in the top 30cm of soil. The analysis estimates the carbon sequestration in tons per hectare after 20 years under improved management, with both a “medium” and a “high” scenario on the model presented in Sommer and Bossio (2014). This analysis is described in the paper cited below:

            Zomer, R.J., Bossio, D.A., Sommer, R., Verchot, L.V.,  2017. Global Sequestration Potential of Increased
Organic  Carbon in Cropland Soils. Scientific Reports 7: http://dx.doi.org/10.1038/s41598-017-15794-8

 The methodology is described in detail in the Supplementary Materials

publicationCitation.value:
Zomer, R.J., Bossio, D.A., Sommer, R., Verchot, L.V.,  2017. Global Sequestration Potential of Increased
Organic  Carbon in Cropland Soils. Scientific Reports 7:

files.description:
This dataset provides per pixel (250m resolution) values of the soil organic carbon on cropland, globally, in tons per hectare (value x 100). The top 30 cm layer 

2 was constructed as weighted average of three soil depth layers: 0-5; 5-15; 15-30 cm.
files.label: 01. Soil Organic Carbon on Croplands.zip

dataFile.description:
This dataset provides per pixel (250m resolution) values of the soil organic carbon on cropland, globally, in tons per hectare (value x 100). The top 30 cm layer 

2 was constructed as weighted average of three soil depth layers: 0-5; 5-15; 15-30 cm.

files.description: This dataset provides per pixel (250m resolution) values of the potential soil organic carbon on cropland after 20 years under the Medium Scenario, in tons per hectare (value x 100).
files.label: 02. Potential SOC on Croplands After 20 Yr - Medium Scenario.zip

dataFile.filename: 02. Potential SOC on Croplands After 20 Yr - Medium Scenario.zip
dataFile.description: This dataset provides per pixel (250m resolution) values of the potential soil organic carbon on cropland after 20 years under the Medium Scenario, in tons per hectare (value x 100).

files.description: This dataset provides per pixel (250m resolution) values of the potential soil organic carbon on cropland after 20 years under the Medium Scenario, in tons per hectare (value x 100).
files.label: 03. Potential SOC on Croplands After 20 Yr - High Scenario.zip

dataFile.filename: 03. Potential SOC on Croplands After 20 Yr - High Scenario.zip
dataFile.description: This dataset provides per pixel (250m resolution) values of the potential soil organic carbon on cropland after 20 years under the Medium Scenario, in tons per hectare (value x 100).

files.description: This dataset provides per pixel (250m resolution) values of the increase in soil organic carbon on cropland after 20 years under the Medium Scenario, in tons per hectare (value x 100), i.e. the difference after 20 years (T2 – T1)
files.label: 04. Increase in SOC on Croplands After 20 Yr - Medium Scenario.zip

dataFile.filename: 04. Increase in SOC on Croplands After 20 Yr - Medium Scenario.zip
dataFile.description: This dataset provides per pixel (250m resolution) values of the increase in soil organic carbon on cropland after 20 years under the Medium Scenario, in tons per hectare (value x 100), i.e. the difference after 20 years (T2 – T1)

files.description: This dataset provides per pixel (250m resolution) values of the increase in soil organic carbon on cropland after 20 years under the High Scenario, in tons per hectare (value x 100), i.e. the difference after 20 years (T2 – T1)
files.label: 05. Increase in SOC on Croplands After 20 Yr - High Scenario.zip

dataFile.filename: 05. Increase in SOC on Croplands After 20 Yr - High Scenario.zip
dataFile.description: This dataset provides per pixel (250m resolution) values of the increase in soil organic carbon on cropland after 20 years under the High Scenario, in tons per hectare (value x 100), i.e. the difference after 20 years (T2 – T1)

files.description: This dataset provides per pixel (250m resolution) values of the soil organic carbon on cropland, globally, in tons per hectare (value x 100), considering the percent of that grid cell which is classified as cropland in the GLC-Share (GLC-02) dataset. Multiply the value by 6.25 (the number of hectares per 250m grid cell) to obtain total tons of carbon per grid cell x 100.
files.label: 06. Soil Organic Carbon on Croplands per Grid Cell.zip

dataFile.filename: 06. Soil Organic Carbon on Croplands per Grid Cell.zip
dataFile.description: This dataset provides per pixel (250m resolution) values of the soil organic carbon on cropland, globally, in tons per hectare (value x 100), considering the percent of that grid cell which is classified as cropland in the GLC-Share (GLC-02) dataset. Multiply the value by 6.25 (the number of hectares per 250m grid cell) to obtain total tons of carbon per grid cell x 100.

Multiply the value by 6.25 (the number of hectares per 250m grid cell) to obtain total tons of carbon per grid cell x 100.

files.description: This dataset provides per pixel (250m resolution) values of the potential soil organic carbon on cropland after 20 years under the Medium Scenario, in tons per hectare (value x 100), considering the percent of that grid cell which is classified as cropland in the GLC-Share (GLC-02) dataset. Multiply the value by 6.25 (the number of hectares per 250m grid cell) to obtain total tons of carbon per grid cell x 100.

dataFile.description: This dataset provides per pixel (250m resolution) values of the potential soil organic carbon on cropland after 20 years under the Medium Scenario, in tons per hectare (value x 100), considering the percent of that grid cell which is classified as cropland in the GLC-Share (GLC-02) dataset. Multiply the value by 6.25 (the number of hectares per 250m grid cell) to obtain total tons of carbon per grid cell x 100.

files.description: This dataset provides per pixel (250m resolution) values of the potential increase in soil organic carbon, i.e. the difference after 20 years (T2 – T1), on cropland after 20 years under the Medium Scenario, in tons per hectare (value x 100), considering the percent of that grid cell which is classified as cropland in the GLC-Share (GLC-02) dataset. Multiply the value by 6.25 (the number of hectares per 250m grid cell) to obtain total tons of carbon per grid cell x 100.
files.label: 09. Increase in SOC on Croplands After 20 Yr - Medium Scenario per Grid Cell.zip

dataFile.filename: 09. Increase in SOC on Croplands After 20 Yr - Medium Scenario per Grid Cell.zip
dataFile.description: This dataset provides per pixel (250m resolution) values of the potential increase in soil organic carbon, i.e. the difference after 20 years (T2 – T1), on cropland after 20 years under the Medium Scenario, in tons per hectare (value x 100), considering the percent of that grid cell which is classified as cropland in the GLC-Share (GLC-02) dataset. Multiply the value by 6.25 (the number of hectares per 250m grid cell) to obtain total tons of carbon per grid cell x 100.

files.description: This dataset provides per pixel (250m resolution) values of the potential increase in soil organic carbon, i.e. the difference after 20 years (T2 – T1), on cropland after 20 years, in tons per hectare (value x 100), considering the percent of that grid cell which is classified as cropland in the GLC-Share (GLC-02) dataset. Multiply the value by 6.25 (the number of hectares per 250m grid cell) to obtain total tons of carbon per grid cell x 100.
files.label: 10. Increase in SOC on Croplands After 20 Yr - High Scenario per Grid Cell.zip

dataFile.filename: 10. Increase in SOC on Croplands After 20 Yr - High Scenario per Grid Cell.zip
dataFile.description: This dataset provides per pixel (250m resolution) values of the potential increase in soil organic carbon, i.e. the difference after 20 years (T2 – T1), on cropland after 20 years, in tons per hectare (value x 100), considering the percent of that grid cell which is classified as cropland in the GLC-Share (GLC-02) dataset. Multiply the value by 6.25 (the number of hectares per 250m grid cell) to obtain total tons of carbon per grid cell x 100.

files.description: This dataset provides per pixel (250m resolution) values of the soil organic carbon on cropland which has been classified as high SOC soils, i.e. > 400 tC/ha or bulk density < 1), globally, in tons per hectare (value x 100), considering the percent of that grid cell which is classified as cropland in the GLC-Share (GLC-02) dataset. Multiply the value by 6.25 (the number of hectares per 250m grid cell) to obtain total tons of carbon per grid cell x 100.
files.label: 11. Soil Organic Carbon on High SOC Croplands per Grid Cell.zip

dataFile.filename: 11. Soil Organic Carbon on High SOC Croplands per Grid Cell.zip
dataFile.description: This dataset provides per pixel (250m resolution) values of the soil organic carbon on cropland which has been classified as high SOC soils, i.e. > 400 tC/ha or bulk density < 1), globally, in tons per hectare (value x 100), considering the percent of that grid cell which is classified as cropland in the GLC-Share (GLC-02) dataset. Multiply the value by 6.25 (the number of hectares per 250m grid cell) to obtain total tons of carbon per grid cell x 100.
